cyclone.name: CLAUDETTE
cyclone.category: Potential Tropical Cyclone (below Tropical Storm strength)
cyclone.current_location: about 310 miles south of Morgan City, Louisiana
cyclone.trajectory: moving north toward the north-central Gulf Coast, then forecast to arc northeastward across the southeastern United States during the weekend
cyclone.hours_to_offshore: N/A (system expected to be an inland remnant low long before reaching New England)

weather_observation.watch_coast: None for the U.S. Northeast; watches confined to northern Gulf Coast
weather_observation.warning_coast: Tropical Storm Warning from Intracoastal City, LA, eastward to the Okaloosa/Walton County line, FL (Lake Pontchartrain, Lake Maurepas, and metro New Orleans included)
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Northern Gulf Coast from Louisiana east to the western Florida Panhandle
weather_observation.expected_closest_date_to_port: 2021-06-22 (as a weak remnant low or frontal wave well inland/offshore)
weather_observation.closest_wind_data_location: Not listed (Boston not included in probability table)
weather_observation.first_hazard: Start of heavy rainfall (if remnants pass near New England)
weather_observation.wind: None (no tropical-storm-force winds expected at Boston, MA)
weather_observation.rainfall: Potential for light to moderate rain early next week as remnants pass well southwest or offshore of New England
weather_observation.other_hazards: None expected for port operations at this time
